data.description: This is an advanced legal research unit in which students work closely with academic mentors from Macquarie Law School, contribute to legal research projects and help present these findings to diverse audiences.  Students will work in teams or individually to contribute to existing legal projects in the Law School and will have the opportunity to learn from and work alongside leading legal scholars with diverse expertise.  Opportunities will vary with each offering and are dependent on the available mentors, but may include assisting on grant applications, attending and contributing to interdisciplinary research seminars, providing research assistance and conducting advanced legal research tasks.The unit aims to engage students with a chosen area of legal research embedded with formal training and high-level supervision of their research over the semester. This is one of four units that form the requirements for students wishing to graduate with a Bachelor of Laws (Honours).
data.title: Applied Legal Research

title: Applied Legal Research
